title: 115_hr4183
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Domestic Violence Records Reporting Improvement Act of 2017". It includes a restriction on NCHIP grants. The Crime Identification Technology Act of 1998 is amended to define the National Instant Criminal Background Check System and domestic violence records for firearms eligibility determinations. The Attorney General is required to report annually to Congress on the accessibility of records from each State through the National Instant Criminal Background Check System. The methodology for calculating these records and ensuring State compliance is determined by the Attorney General in consultation with the States. The Attorney General reports annually to Congress on record accessibility through the National Instant Criminal Background Check System, in consultation with States. Records of individuals convicted of domestic violence misdemeanors or under court orders are accessible for background checks. The National Instant Criminal Background Check System includes records of individuals ineligible to purchase firearms due to court orders or being identified in the Protection Order File. States must contribute to record accessibility to be eligible for grants under this section. The National Instant Criminal Background Check System requires states to make a certain percentage of records accessible to be eligible for grants. Failure to comply results in reallocation of funds to compliant states. SEC. 3. NARIP FUNDING FOR DOMESTIC VIOLENCE REPORTING. (a) Implementation Assistance to States.--Section 103(c) of the NICS Improvement Amendments Act of 2007 is amended to waive the requirement of a relief from disabilities program for states seeking grants to improve accessibility of records in the National Instant Criminal Background Check System. 
(b) Disposition Records Automation and Transmittal Improvement Grants under the same Act are also amended for efficiency. The Attorney General may waive the relief from disabilities program requirement for states to receive grants under the NICS Improvement Amendments Act if the grant's primary purpose is to enhance the accessibility of records in the National Instant Criminal Background Check System.
